title: Game Start - Collapsed
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Game Start notification
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the probable pitchers and stats.

Example:
WSH vs. ATL about to start
Pitching: Lester (WSH) vs. Smyly (ATL)

title: Lead Change - Collapsed
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Lead Change notification
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the lead change information

Example:
David Ortiz homers in the bottom of the 5th, Dustin Pedroia scores. The Red Sox now lead the Yankees, 4-2.

title: Scoring Play - Collapsed
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Score Change notification
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the score change information

Example:

David Ortiz homers in the bottom of the 5th, Dustin Pedroia scores. The Red Sox extend their lead over the Yankees, 6-2.

title: Pitching Change - Collapsed
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Pitching Change notification
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the pitching change information.

Example:

Brad Ziegler (3.15 ERA) relieves Rick Porcello (8.1 IP, 103 pitches) in the 9th. The Red Sox lead the Yankees, 4-2.

title: Game End - Collapsed
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone 
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Game End notification
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the game wrap information.

Example:
The Marlins beat the Nationals, 8-6, WP: Paul Campbell(2-3), LP: Kyle Finnegan(5-7).

title: In-Game Video Highlights - Collapsed
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone 
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives an In-Game Video Highlight notification

title: In-Game Video Highlights - Expanded
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone with 3D Touch
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps:
When a user receives a In-Game Video Highlights notification
and the video shareable flag is not set
and long presses the notification
custom_expected: Then the user will see the following from top to bottom

custom_steps_separated.content:
Video thumbnail
Play button
Headline
Duration (MM:SS)
Button for Gameday
custom_steps_separated.expected: and tapping will bring the user to Gameday for the game

title: In-Game Video Highlights - Expanded (Lite User)
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone with 3D Touch
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
and user is a Lite user
custom_steps:
When a user receives a In-Game Video Highlights notification
and long presses the notification
custom_expected: Then the user will see the following from top to bottom

custom_steps_separated.expected: Then a pre-roll add will play before the video

custom_steps_separated.content:
Video thumbnail
Play button
Headline
Duration (MM:SS)
Button for Share
custom_steps_separated.expected: and tapping will open the Share sheet

custom_steps_separated.content: Button for Gameday
custom_steps_separated.expected: and tapping will bring the user to Gameday for the game

title: Player Notification -> Key Highlights -> Receiving the push notification
custom_preconds:
*User should have the MLB app installed
*User should be following at least one Player
*User should have the Notifications enabled
*The followed Player(s) should have the Key Highlights notification enabled
*The followed Player(s) should have been involved in a good play (deemed a highlight)
custom_steps: WHEN the "Key Highlight" play occurs, the user should be receiving a Key Highlight push notification in the next 15 mins.
custom_expected: THEN the notification should contain the text: "Here's a highlight for [Name of the Followed Player] Tap to watch the gameplay video"

title: Condensed Game - Collapsed
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone 
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Condensed Game notification

title: Condensed Game - Expanded
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone with 3D Touch
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps:
When a user receives a Condensed Game notification
and long presses the notification
custom_expected: Then the user will see the following from top to bottom

custom_steps_separated.content:
Video thumbnail
Play button
Headline
Duration (MM:SS)
Button for Watch in MLB app
Button for Wrap
custom_steps_separated.expected: and tapping will bring the user to Gameday Wrap for the game

custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives an MLB News notification
custom_expected:
Then the user will see MLB News then the editorial content
and a MLB logo

Example:

Title: MLB News
Body: {editorial content}

title: Receiving Notification
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed on an iPhone
and the user is subscribed to push notifications
custom_steps: When a user receives a notification and swipes the notification upward or waits five seconds
custom_expected: Then the notification will be dismissed

title: In-App Notification - Sounds
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to the app's push notifications
and has sounds enabled on the phone
custom_steps:
When the user is actively in the MLB app 
and receives a push notification
custom_expected: Then the push notification will not make a sound

title: In-App Notification - Notification Center
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to the app's push notifications
custom_steps:
When the user is actively in the MLB app 
and receives a push notification
but does not tap to launch it
custom_expected:
Then the user will see a system-based notification
and the notification will be available in the Notification Center

title: In-App Notification - Gameday/MLB.TV feed
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to a team's Gameday push notifications
and the team has a game in progress
custom_steps:
When the user is watching that team's MLB.TV feed 
and a play happens in that game, for which the user would have received a Gameday push notification
(scoring play, lead change, pitching change, etc)
custom_expected: Then the user should not receive that push notification

title: In-App Notification - Gameday/MLB.TV/Picture-in-Picture
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to a team's Gameday push notifications
and the team has a game in progress
custom_steps:
When the user is watching that team's MLB.TV feed in Picture in Picture
and a play happens in that game, for which the user would have received a Gameday push notification
(scoring play, lead change, pitching change, etc)
custom_expected: Then the user should not receive that push notification

title: In-App Notification - Gameday/Hide Scores
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to a team's Gameday push notifications
and the team has a game in progress
and has Hide Scores enabled
custom_steps:
When the user is actively in the app
and a play happens in a game, for which the user would have received a Gameday push notification
custom_expected: Then the user should not receive any Gameday push notification

title: Lite User > Video Notifications
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed on an iPhone
and the user is subscribed to push notifications
and the user is a Lite user
custom_steps:
When the Lite user receives a video push notification
(could be News, In-Game Video Highlights, or Condensed Game)
and the user taps to launch the notification
custom_expected:
Then the app will launch
and a pre-roll ad will play before the video

title: Mid inning state
custom_steps:
GIVEN the game is between innings

WHEN displaying that information in the Live Activity

THEN hide count & base path details and display “Mid [Inning Number]”

title: Team At Bat Indicator
custom_steps:
GIVEN a live activity is not between inning (but rather in the middle of a live inning)

WHEN displaying the data on the platter

THEN add an indicator to the team that is at bat

title: Mid inning in play
custom_steps:
GIVEN the game is in play

WHEN displaying that information in the Live Activity

THEN display [bot/top][inning]
AND bases, count, and outs
AND at bat indicator pointing to the team that is currently at bat
AND pitcher and player at bat

title: Live activities toggle
custom_preconds: User has a favorite team set in account settings
custom_steps:
GIVEN that user is on scores page

AND favorite team is about to play in the next 2 hours

WHEN user enables the track action item

AND refreshes the page

THEN the button should stay enabled

title: Live Activities - Probable pitchers
custom_steps:
GIVEN a game is not in the Live or Final state / the game has not started yet

WHEN there are game state changes (e.g. pregame > warmup)

THEN do not display the game state change

AND just display the starting Pitcher last name for both team’s until the game starts and there is P/AB information to display

title: Game Transitions from Scheduled to Delayed or Postponed
custom_steps:
GIVEN a Live Activity is already on a users lockscreen

WHEN that game transitions from a scheduled state to a delayed state or postponed state

THEN we will display the updated game status on the platter of the Live Activity per the design

title: Display Starting Pitchers In Delayed State
custom_steps:
GIVEN a Live Activity has entered the delayed state

WHEN populating the chin of the live activity

THEN display the starting pitchers for both teams (as we do in a scheduled or warmup state)

title: LA Lock Screen - game is SCHEDULED
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB app installed on Device
AND user is logged in
AND user has Live Activity on
AND game has a scheduled state

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in light mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN LA card has a light background
AND both team logos are displayed and have an outline
AND the game start time with AM/PM is displayed
AND user time zone is displayed

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410447)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in dark mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN LA card has a dark background
AND both team logos are displayed and have an outline
AND the game start time with AM/PM is displayed
AND user time zone is displayed

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410448)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the LA card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to MLB app score page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game starts (when we receive a first update, should happen after the warm-up but before the first throw)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the LA card view changes to live

title: Live Activities -> Player Substitution
custom_preconds:
* User has application installed
* User has notifications enabled
custom_steps:
GIVEN the user's followed or favorite team is playing
AND user has live activities enabled for that game
WHEN a player is substituted in that game
THEN the user should see the player substitution on the lock screen activity display

title: LA Lock Screen - game is LIVE
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB app installed on Device
AND user is logged in
AND user has Live Activity on
AND game is live

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in light mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with:

* light Live Activity card
* team logos
* current score underneath team logos
* current inning between team logos
* runner on bases graphic
* ball count and outs

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410451)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in dark mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with: 

* dark Live Activity card
* team logos
* current score underneath team logos
* current inning between team logos
* runner on bases graphic
* ball count and outs

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410452)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the LA card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to MLB app score page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game gets final
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the LA card view changes to final

title: LA Lock Screen - game is DELAYED
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB app installed on Device
AND user is logged in
AND user has Live Activity on
AND game has a delayed state
custom_expected:
Delayed - 
game will be played today
game will not be scheduled again at a later date
game may still transition to a Postponed or Suspended status

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in light mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN LA card has a light background
AND both team logos are displayed and have an outline
AND 'Delayed Start' is displayed between the logos

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410491)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in dark mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN LA card has a dark background
AND both team logos are displayed and have an outline
AND 'Delayed Start' is displayed between the logos

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410661)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the LA card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to MLB app score page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game gets live
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the LA card view changes to live

title: Live Activities -> Pitcher Change
custom_preconds:
* User has application installed
* User has notifications enabled
custom_steps:
GIVEN the user's followed or favorite team is playing
AND user has live activities enabled for that game
WHEN a pitcher is changed in that game
THEN the user should see the pitcher change on the lock screen activity display

title: LA Lock Screen - game is LIVE - DELAYED
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB app installed on Device
AND user is logged in
AND user has Live Activity on
AND game has started but then got delayed
custom_steps:
Delayed -
game will be played today
game will not be scheduled again at a later date
game may still transition to a Postponed or Suspended status.

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in light mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with:

* light Live Activity card
* team logos
* current score underneath team logos
* current inning between team logos and 'Delayed' 
* runner on bases graphic
* ball count and outs

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410497)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in dark mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with:

* dark Live Activity card
* team logos
* current score underneath team logos
* current inning between team logos and 'Delayed' 
* runner on bases graphic
* ball count and outs

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410498)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the LA card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to MLB app score page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN game starts again
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN game starts from the inning that it got stopped

title: LA Lock Screen - game is POSTPONED
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB app installed on Device
AND user is logged in
AND user has Live Activity on
AND game has a postponed state
custom_expected:
Postponed
game has not started
game will not be played today
game will be scheduled again at a later date

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in light mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN LA card has a light background
AND both team logos are displayed and have an outline
AND 'Postponed' is displayed between the logos

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410659)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in dark mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN LA card has a dark background
AND both team logos are displayed and have an outline
AND 'Delayed Start' is displayed between the logos

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410660)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the LA card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to MLB app score page
Note: the LA card should only be displayed for about 4 hours in this case (iOS functionality)

title: LA Lock Screen - game is SUSPENDED
custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB app installed on Device
AND user is logged in
AND user has Live Activity on
AND game has started but got suspended
custom_expected:
Suspended
game has started
game will not be played today
game will be scheduled again at a later date

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in light mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN LA card has a light background

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410667)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the LA card in dark mode
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN LA card has a dark background
AND both team logos are displayed and have an outline
AND current scores are displayed underneath the team logos
AND current inning and 'Suspended' between team logos
AND runner on bases graphic
AND ball count and outs

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410668)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the LA card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to MLB app score page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the game is rescheduled at a later date
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN it will have a resumed status

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN / IF the game status changes to final
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the game will have a final-Early state (separate TC)

GIVEN MLB app installed on Device

AND game is final

team logos
* team logos
* final score 
* 'Final' between the team logos

custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to MLB app score page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the score board
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'Track Game' cta is not there

custom_preconds:
GIVEN MLB app installed on Device

AND user has Live Activity on
AND game went to extra innings and got final

custom_steps_separated.expected:

team logos

![](index.php?/attachments/get/13410479)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user clicks on the LA card
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user is taken to MLB app score page

title: Teams page - user has a favorite team and NO followed teams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has an MLB app on Apple Watch
AND user has a favorite team selected
AND user doesn't have followed teams

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with first slide

* Time on the top right corner
* Team logo
* Team color background  (around 70% of the screen)
* Team name 
* Division
* Wins losses, games behind
* Game mini states/scores (separate TC)
* Page indicator with first circle highlighted

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user taps on the screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN screen is not tappable

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scrolls up and down
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN screen is not scrollable

title: Teams page - user has a favorite team and followed teams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has an MLB app on Apple Watch
AND user has a favorite team selected
AND user has followed teams selected

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with first slide
AND user's favorite team is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scrolls down
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user sees followed team info in the same format as favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scrolls down more
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN next followed team is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has all teams selected as followed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN all teams are displayed in the list

title: Teams page - user has NO favorite team and NO followed teams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has an MLB app on Apple Watch
AND user does NOT have a favorite team selected
AND user does NOT have followed teams selected

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with first slide

* Time on the top right corner
* 'No Team' title
* copy 'Add your favorite and followed teams in the MLB App'

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN user clicks on 'Open MLB App' CTA
AND user's phone is unlocked
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user's MLB app is opened on users phone
AND user is brought to favorite/followed team page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects the favorite/followed team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN teams page on Apple Watch gets updated with user's favorite/followed team
Note: user might need to refresh the page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scrolls down
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN screen is not scrollable

title: Teams page - user doesn't have a favorite team but has followed teams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has an MLB app on Apple Watch
AND user doesn't have a favorite team selected
AND user has followed teams selected
custom_expected: User can add a favorite team in the app, then click edit to remove it

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user opens the MLB app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with first slide
AND user's followed team is displayed

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scrolls down
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN next followed team is displayed (if any)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user has all teams selected as followed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN all teams are displayed in the list

title: Scores page - user has a favorite team and NO followed teams
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has an MLB app on Apple Watch
AND user has a favorite team
AND user doesn't have a followed team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user slides left on the home screen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN user is displayed with second slide
AND the header of the slide is 'Live'
AND user is displayed with list of the games (separate TC for list logic)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user scrolls down
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN user sees more games

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views live games
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'LIVE' label is displayed on the top left corner

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user's views game of their favorite team
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the star is displayed next to the team name

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views final games
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'FINAL' label is displayed on the top left corner

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the rest of the game list
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the games are divided in sections:

- Upcoming
- Final

- Upcoming
- Final

title: Standings page - user has fav team - league order
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has an MLB app on Apple Watch
AND user has a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Standings page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the League Standings order of divisions would start with the users favorite team’s division
AND the order of the next two divisions would be the other divisions in the same league of the users favorite team in DDO
AND the order of the next three divisions would be three divisions from the other league in DDO
AND the Wild Card Standings should start with the league of your favorite team

Example
Given a Cardinals Fan

NL Central

NL East

NL West

AL East

AL Central

AL West

NL Wild Card

AL Wild Card

title: Standings page - user doesn't have fav team - league order
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user has an MLB app on Apple Watch
AND user doesn't have a favorite team

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user views the Standings page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the order of divisions would be the DDO (Default Division Order) 

Default Division Order (DDO)
League ID & Division ID can be found at league.id & division.id

League Standings

1. American League 103

AL East – 201

AL Central – 202

AL West – 200

2. National League  104

NL East – 204

NL Central – 205

NL West – 203

Wild Card Standings

American League Wild Card

National League Wild Card
